name: deploy-gae-build-task
author: Google Cloud Tools
description: Deploy your app to Google App Engine.

inputs.name: serviceEndpoint
inputs.label: GCP connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Google Cloud Platform connection to use.

inputs.name: deploymentPath
inputs.label: Deployment source
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location of the files to deploy.

inputs.name: yamlFileName
inputs.label: YAML file name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the [YAML configuration file](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/dotnet/configuration-files) to deploy. [app.yaml](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/dotnet/configuring-your-app-with-app-yaml) or a custom filename defines the deployment of an app. [cron.yaml](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/dotnet/scheduling-jobs-with-cron-yaml), [dispatch.yaml](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/dotnet/how-requests-are-routed#routing_with_a_dispatch_file), [dos.yaml](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/python/config/dosref), [index.yaml](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/go/configuring-datastore-indexes-with-index-yaml) and [queue.yaml](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/python/config/queueref) configure your app.

inputs.name: copyYaml
inputs.label: Copy YAML from source folder.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option if you need the task to copy your YAML file to your deployment source folder.

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to source folder to copy your YAML file from.

inputs.name: storageBucket
inputs.label: Staging GCS Bucket
inputs.helpMarkDown: The [Google Cloud Storage](https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs) bucket used to stage files associated with the deployment. If this argument is not specified, the application's default code bucket is used.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of the app that will be created or replaced by this deployment. If you do not specify a version, one will be generated for you. e.g. $(Build.BuildNumber)

inputs.name: promote
inputs.label: Promote
inputs.helpMarkDown: Promote the deployed version to receive all traffic.

inputs.name: stopPrevious
inputs.label: Stop Previous Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Stop the previously running version when deploying a new version.
